result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawna Marie Powless was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Def placed on a pymt plan of $20/mo beginning 2/25/17.
Def granted wk/child care release privledges.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
Follow ALL Doctors orders.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes: Def granted credit for time served.

records.addlTxt: 09:20 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Maintained sob, tst as req -  8 days sob. got to 4 out of five contacts, comm service, tst clean. Has been placed on a waiting list for residential treatment. Will be asked to go when avail -  if needed, Ct orders monitor off. Further proceedings scheduled for April 3, 2019 at 09:00 am.

09:22 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  4 days sob,main sob, missed tst on sat. Got to jail outside tsting hours and would not allow it. Tst on Mon and tsted clean. Got to all sob contacts. Corpl. Kulik reports she is not where she should be on the monitor. Kulik reports....she did not report she was going places she went to, dead battery, Kulik askes for better communication regarding outings. lckdwn on monitor means stay in home, leave for med appts, worship, trtmt appts. Ct orders no daily contacts and follw existing trtmt plan, recc is 5 daily contacts, 1 AODA, ct lifts lockdwn, and stay on monitor and cerfew. In phase 2  Further proceedings scheduled for March 20, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Order of Commitment to Jail

Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. recc  from DC for inpatient trtmr, missed UA from Thursady an Friday, this is preventing going to trtmt, AODA assessment needs ro be donre with Bad River AODA. COntact BR AODA and get that assess,met donr. Has not signed release of inf for LE Phillips, dead batt on monitor last Friday, team voted for a 1 day jail sanction, appt in Chippewa Falls tomorrow, releasing in time to go to appt. MTM is to pick her up tomorrow at 10 a.m. Report to drug ct next week unless in treatment. Ct orders to tst daily and all previous conditions continue. Further proceedings scheduled for March 13, 2019 at 09:00 am.

DC staff voted to approve residential trtmt program monies. EMP violations and continue to test positive. Ct orders Daily sob contacts, on lock down on monitor appear next wk if not in trtment.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 6, 2019 at 09:00 am.

09:37 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  David Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def left residental trtmt  on Friday 2/15/2019. Def wants to complete trtmt. used since last test,Bad River AODA and drug CT staff looking for another trtmt plan, comply with lckdown on monitor and keep batt chged. meet with brenda spurlock and Samantha Hedican for instruct of Drug court proc by  next wk  Further proceedings scheduled for February 27, 2019 at 09:00 am.

09:45 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Going to trmt today. Drug Ct will transport Def to her home and then to trtmt. Def cut her monitor off, drug Ct has it.
Commitment to Jail

10:29 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Courtney Latzig .  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Time for a du process hearing. Atty comments on right to du process hearing. Def needs to be present at dental appt on Friday. Drug court can give Def a ride. Court would reduce sanction from 72 to 48 hours -- get out Friday at 11 AM and not have to come back-- then could get daughter to appt. Def accepts 48 hour sanction. Sanction is effective now 10:20 AM. Test as req. Leaving for treatment on 2/13/19. If def still in community next Wed, needs to be at Drug Ct at 9 AM. Released from jail -- call in, test as req. Test prior to going to jail today and prior to being released. Kulik can transport today. Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 13, 2019 at 09:00 am.

09:51 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sched to go to Res trmt next week. Def feels that is where she needs to be. On lckdwn since last ct date, had violations while on lckdwn.  Non compliant on monitor. Def provided Ct w/ doctor/ ER paperwork.  Def lost chrger for monitor. Tm reccommmend a sanction of 72 hrs in jail for dead battery. Def wants a due process hearing.

09:44 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def states she didn't have any knowledge of sanction for monitor. Team voted for a 6 day jail sanction -- Def has credit for sanction. Rec from treatment provider for in-patient treatment. Def would like some time to think about it. Ct orders to meet with treatment provider. Meet with treatment provider today. Team rec be placed on montior and lockdown. Rec of team to follow treatment providers rec. If in in-patient treatment, won't have to be here on 2/6/19.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 6, 2019 at 09:00 am.

09:12 AM Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court, in custody.  David Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawna Marie Powless appeared by video means. Missed Drug Court -- WARRANT CANCELLED> Def is on probation..  Further proceedings scheduled for January 23, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Nationwide

Missed meetings and missed some call-ins. Suppose to have 4 social support meetings and 1 individual. Ct orders to come back in 1 week and have an appt with DR scheduled regarding brain injury. If not done, then will be placed on the monitor.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 31, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Def has used since last court date. Stuggled a little bit, but got herself back on track.  Keep up the good work. to beat herself up over it.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 24, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Def's mom went to the hospital and the def stayed home with kids. Def got her treatment hours in. Ct is happy she stopped and that she is in court today. Def has an apt set up to talk with a Doctor. Def has an apt to meet with indiv counselor. Sob time starts over and follow treatment plan. Test daily until clean sample and then random testing.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 17, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Tested as req, but did use a mind altering substance last Wednesday, Def wrote about her use on a self report, good attitude about the use because she does not want it to hold her back. Ask to follow recommendations  Further proceedings scheduled for September 19, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def was present for the waiver. Signed waiver, no threat or force. Ct accepts the waiver. 53 days sob. Def is doing great in drug court. Def needs to file a phase move letter. Def is doing stuff in the community. Doing great. incentive  Further proceedings scheduled for September 12, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Used since last hearing. Used one day on Saturday. Has had a bad month. Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. MAS - YES - Attend drug testing every day - NO.  Thought Judge said daily contacts.  Order was daily contacts and daily testing. Last time drug tested was Friday she believes. Last time drug tested where it was negative was thurs of last week, May 3, 2018.  May 3 was negative, May 4 negative, May 5 - no show, May 6 no show and May 7 no show. Did call in every day though. Treatment? - attending yes.  On time? - late a couple of times.  Treatment yesteday - no.  Court - 7 questions to answer, test daily, attend treatment each day scheduled, if no treatment sched then attn support meeting.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 15, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court.   MAS - yes.  Tests showing positive for controlled substances. Used during program. Last used - last week on Monday.  Still testing positive. Recc to attend residential treatment? - yes. Communication with Cpl Kulick re:  Em. regarding violation.  EM died without being charged.  Judge questions Cpl. Kulick - texted Powless regarding EM dying and could go to jail.  27-30th EM was out of service and is dying again today.  Judge orders to comply with monitor.  Treatment plan - continue with.  Daily UA/contacts IOP 4 - AODA  Further proceedings scheduled for May 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Used since last court, used once, Used Meth and Gab. She got mad and used. After she used she was upset. Does not think she will use this coming week, Has Sob friends. Showing up to were she needs to be, and needs to be honest. Follow treatment plan. no contact with known users unless jail or treatment, Schd. appt with mental health provider. By next Tuesday have apt completed or schd. by next court date.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 1, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DId not maintain Sob, almost got kicked out of house. talked it out. Using was the main way to deal with stress. Used on Saturday. Used twice. kept all of her appts. Lost her activity log. Follow treatment plan. Meet with drug court staff after court, meet with Kulick to switch monitor  Further proceedings scheduled for April 24, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. used yesterday. go into house and get rid of anything in there. For Probation Review

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shawna Marie Powless in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF55,16CF57. Agreement from parties. 16CF55 with be DRI. 16CF57 the def will pleas G/NC to counts 1,2,4 any remaining counts will be DRI. Understands charges and penalties. PLEADS NC to each count. admits she is a repeater. COunt 3,5,and 6 are DRI. and case 16CF55 is DRI. Signed PQ. Understands PQ. no threat or force to plead nc. No mind altering substances. Understands elements of each crime. Wants court to accept pleas of NC. Ct accepts plea and finds G.  State complied with vic rights. State filed motion to allow crim convictions which sets forth def's prior history. Ct reviewed motion- Atty comments that the recommendation is appropriate  Does think she has 29 days of sentence credit, both state and atty agree to this. Has been a good inmate. Def comments - wants to change and get home to children. not working right now- from brian injury. Ct agrees with agreement. Ct might go lighter in the jail sentence. Ct orders EAch CT   SENTENCING - withheld sentence of 18 months with conditions of: 60 days in jail, with 29 days credit, Work and child care release,   AODA and follow through, ABSOl, Pres as pres, Follow doctor orders,  UA, other Counseling , DNA, $10 fine and costs,CT 1 $567.63, CT 2 488.88, Ct4 499.80. no gun no vote. Payments be $20 a month beginning 2/25/17  from release from cust. Set current. 31 days left to serve.  Contra band seized ordered forf. Ct gives credit for being honest.
